# LazyCloud CLI Overview

The LazyCloud CLI (`lazycloud`) is a command-line tool for managing your cloud machines and resources.

## Installation

Install the LazyCloud CLI using pip:

```bash
pip install lazycloud
```

## Getting Started

Before using the CLI, you'll need to:

1. Set up your API key:
- Copy your default API key from [lazycloud.dev/api-keys](https://lazycloud.dev/api-keys)
```bash
# Add your API key
lazycloud auth add default YOUR_API_KEY

# Set it as active
lazycloud auth set default
```

2. Set up SSH keys for machine access:
```bash
# Generate SSH key pair if you don't have one
ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "your_email@example.com"

# Add the SSH key to your account
lazycloud ssh add my-ssh-key
```

## Basic Usage

Here's a simple example of creating and managing a machine:

```bash
# Create a new machine (interactive)
lazycloud machines create my-machine

# List your machines
lazycloud machines ls

# Connect to the machine
lazycloud machines connect my-machine

# When done, clean up
lazycloud machines destroy my-machine
```

## Getting Help

The CLI provides built-in help for all commands:

```bash
# List all available commands
lazycloud --help

# Get help for a specific command group
lazycloud machines --help

# Get help for a specific command
lazycloud machines create --help
```

For more detailed information about specific commands, refer to the individual command documentation.
